CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert Carson, 107 49th Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "I don't think that the average family spends too much time watching television."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Carson, wearing striped shirt, plaid jacket, and dark pants, standing with hands in pockets on Liberty Avenue with automobiles, and buildings, one with sign reading "Mellon Bank" on right
